title: Stocks Climb at Start of Short Week, Fed Says Consumer Borrowing Hit New High
content:
(NEW YORK) — A positive day on Wall Street to begin the shortened week, prompted in part by a late jump for China’s stock market. 
 
The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 390.3 to a close of 16492.68. 
 
The Nasdaq climbed 128.01 to 4811.93, while the S&P 500 closed at 1969.41, a gain of 48.19 from its open. 
 
Ahead of Wednesday’s big announcement, Apple was among the big gainers Tuesday — finishing the trading session up nearly three percent. 
 
The Federal Reserve said Tuesday that consumer borrowing hit a new high last month, up $19.1 billion. That data, experts say, is evidence that the economy is on the mend, and could eventually be a factor in when the Fed decides to raise interest rates.
